frameDefinitions: The words in this frame describe a period of time, as opposed to a point in time.
This is an abstract frame for acts performed by sentient beings.
Unless a particular Required_situation obtains, Negative_consequences will follow.
This frame is concerned with the sounds produced by animate entities by means of their vocal tracts.
Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Responsible_party is required to perform some Duty.
The speaker believes that some state of affairs or entity (the Requirement) must be present in order to cause some other dependent state of affairs to occur (the Dependent).
frameExamples: The best <t>time</t> of year for planting tends to be fairly regular.
You <t>must</t> turn in your test by 5 p.m.
He woke up because of the <t>cries</t> of the crows outside.
It is my <t>duty</t> to fight any attack on the Brotherhood .
listRoleDefinitions: A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>State</fen>'s duration.  In this frame, the duration can be inexact.
An ongoing state whose duration can be measured.
This role identifies the <fen>Act</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the intentional act.
This role identifies the time when the Agent acts intentionally.
This role identifies the place where the intentional act occurs.
The state-of-affairs which prevents <fen>Negative_consequences</fen>.
The period during which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is necessary to prevent negative consequences.
The location within which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is required.
An entity that is construed as a single point source emitting sound.

The location at which sound is produced. This role differs from <fen>Location_of_sound_source</fen> in that it does not highlight the sound's spreading from its source to the perceiver's location, which is usually indicated by the preposition 'from'.
The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The time interval during which the Responsibly_party is obligated to fulfill the Duty.
A location in which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> has a specified <fen>Duty</fen> .
The Cognizer requires or believes he/she requires the Requirement to hold so that the Dependent will occur.
The entity or state-of-affairs that must be present or obtain in order for the Dependent to obtain.
The state-of-affairs which cannot hold without the <fen>Requirement</fen>.
An undesirable state-of-affairs that results if the <fen>Requirement</fen> is not met.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> requires the <fen>Requirement</fen>.
The location of the <fen>Cognizer</fen> when he/she requires the <fen>Requirement</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>He was a great actor</fex> in his time.
He was told that <fex>when he got back</fex> , his column needed a serious rethink .
<fex>In California</fex> , seatbelts must be fastened at all times .
He woke up because of the cries <fex>of the crows outside</fex>.
The hiss of snakes <fex>outside the tent</fex> was a constant source of worry.
My job is <fex>to get to the other side of the bridge</fex>.
<fex>At that time</fex> men were obligated to marry women from their own community.
I almost forgot to tell you that <fex>in Sweden</fex> we are obligated to spend atleast 7.5 months in the army for training.
He needs to focus on his schoolwork, <fex>or he's not going to pass the third grade</fex>.
<fex>Over at Merv's house</fex> they need three more cement trucks to finish the job.
